result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Lenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  
-Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  On July 11, 2016 the Court sets the Ct Appt'd Atty Fees at $518.00.
With Huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

11:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Vanden Branden recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Heil concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Heil.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-20 days county jail with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Re-payment of Ct Appt'd Atty Fees
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 11:27 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Heil - requests one final date to wrap up discussions with ADA.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on June 21, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:05 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

9:25 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests a court appointed attorney.  Court questions defendant regarding employment.  Defendant to pay $70.00 per month commencing May 1, and the 1st of each month thereafter.  Court will appoint counsel.  

Court adjourned at 9:27 a.m.
Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests to waive his right to counsel.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA recites offer - upon plea to count 1 count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant does accept the offer.  Defendant requests to speak with the DA.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment to meet with the Asst District Attorney before the next court date.

Court adjourned at 9:49 a.m.

Defendant is to have NO Contact with T.R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Defendant is to have NO Contact with T.R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Defendant is to have NO Contact with T.R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
